mizerEcopath 0.1.0.9013

Convert a proportional diet matrix to absolute consumption

Source: R/matchDiet.R
convertDietMatrix.Rd

This internal helper function converts a diet matrix expressed in proportions (i.e. each row summing to 1) into a matrix of absolute consumption (i.e. biomass consumed per year), based on the species' total consumption rates. It also restricts the matrix to include only the modelled species (i.e. drops the "other" column and any unmatched rows). The conversion is done by multiplying each row of the input diet matrix by the total consumption of the corresponding predator species. This gives the absolute biomass consumed by each predator from each prey.

Usage

convertDietMatrix(diet_matrix, params, min_w_pred, max_w_pred)

Arguments

diet_matrix

A numeric matrix where rows correspond to predator species and columns to prey species (plus an optional "other" column). Rows must sum to 1. Should include all model species as both row and column names.

params

A MizerParams object

min_w_pred

The minimum weight of predators to include in the diet matrix. Default is 0.

max_w_pred

The maximum weight of predators to include in the diet matrix. Default is Inf.

Value

A numeric matrix with dimensions n_species x n_species, giving absolute consumption rates (g/year) for each predator–prey pair.

Details

This functions is intended for internal use and is called by matchDiet().
